list.name: Replica started
list.rawQuery:
SELECT
  extract(epoch from time_column) AS time,
  text_column as text,
  tags_column as tags
FROM
  metric_table
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(time_column)

panels.description: The average number of rounds between finalization and certification.
panels.title: Certification lag (finalized_height - certified_height)

panels.description: The average number of entries kept in the ingress history
panels.title: Ingress messages in history

panels.description: The average rate of ingress messages that expire before being picked up for execution.

targets.expr:
label_replace(
   quantile by (ic_subnet) (
     0.5,
     rate(scheduler_expired_ingress_messages_count{ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",instance=~"$instance"}[1h])
     /
     sum without (status) (rate(mr_inducted_ingress_message_count{ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",instance=~"$instance", status="success"}[1h]))
   ),
  "ic_subnet", "$1", "ic_subnet", "([a-z0-9]+)-.*"
)

panels.title: Expired ingress messages rate

panels.description:
Replicated messages executed per second, by type.

The left Y axis measures replicated messages (shown above the zero line); the right Y axis measures non-replicated queries (shown below the zero line). Note the different scales, as there are usually way more non-replicated queries than other types of messages.
panels.title: Replicated message rate by type

panels.description:
Failed replicated message executions per second, by  subnet and error condition.

The left Y axis measures replicated messages (shown above the zero line); the right Y axis measures non-replicated queries (shown below the zero line). Note the different scales, as there are usually way more non-replicated queries than other types of messages.
panels.title: Failed replicated message rate, by type

panels.description:
Non-replicated queries executed per second

The left Y axis measures replicated messages (shown above the zero line); the right Y axis measures non-replicated queries (shown below the zero line). Note the different scales, as there are usually way more non-replicated queries than other types of messages.
panels.title: Non-replicated query rate

panels.description:
Failed query executions per second, by  subnet and error condition.

The left Y axis measures replicated messages (shown above the zero line); the right Y axis measures non-replicated queries (shown below the zero line). Note the different scales, as there are usually way more non-replicated queries than other types of messages.
panels.title: Failed non-replicated query rate, by type

panels.description:
The average CPU usage measured in CPU time spent per second.

Values larger than 1 indicate multiple threads running in parallel.
panels.title: Process CPU usage

panels.description: The average number of threads.
panels.title: Process threads

panels.description: The RAM usage of the replica process.
panels.title: Replica resident memory

panels.description: The average number of execution threads.
panels.title: Round execution threads

panels.description: Over-approximation of the RAM used for storing dirty Wasm pages until the next checkpoint.
panels.title: Current heap delta

panels.description:
The total memory usage of all canisters combined.

This is the logical memory and is not necessarily kept in RAM.
panels.title: Total canister memory

panels.description: Total number of states loaded to memory by the state manager.
panels.title: Number of states in memory

panels.description:
The total number of skipped round executions.

The rounds are skipped because the uncommitted canister state kept in memory is too large. This number should go to zero on the next checkpoint.
panels.title: Total number of rounds skipped due to large heap delta

panels.description: The rate at which canisters access new locations in memory requires the corresponding page to be fetched.
panels.title: Accessed bytes per second

panels.description: The RAM used for storing dirty Wasm pages until the next checkpoint.
panels.title: Hypervisor allocated memory

panels.description:
Distribution of memory pages accessed per executed message, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

A memory page is 4096 bytes,
panels.title: Wasm accessed page distribution

panels.description: The RAM usage of the Rust heap.
panels.title: Rust resident memory

panels.description: The total number of changes in canister history per canister on a subnet.
panels.title: Total number of changes in canister history per canister

panels.description: The rate at which canisters write to new locations in memory producing dirty pages that need to be saved.
panels.title: Dirty bytes per second

panels.description: Counts of heap delta rate limited canisters per round, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Heap delta rate limited canisters per round

panels.description:
Distribution of dirty pages (resulting from memory writes) per executed message, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

A memory page is 4096 bytes,
panels.title: Wasm dirty pages distribution

panels.description: How many times the inner round iteration was executed within the outer round
panels.title: The number of iterations per round

panels.description: Distribution of heap delta debits per round, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**. Any entry over the current rate limit should indicate a canister that doesn't get to run in a given round. The current limit is stored in the SchedulerConfig.
panels.title: Heap delta debits

panels.description: The average duration of Wasm compilation
panels.title: Wasm compile time, avg

panels.description: The number of DTS executions per round.
panels.title: DTS executions per round

panels.description:
Non-idle canisters that have a heartbeat or an incoming message.

Such canisters can be scheduled for execution in a round (but are not necessarily executed due to instruction limits).
panels.title: Non-idle canisters

panels.description:
Distribution of non-idle canisters that have a heartbeat or an incoming message, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

Such canisters can be scheduled for execution in a round (but are not necessarily executed due to instruction limits).
panels.title: Non-idle canisters distribution

panels.description: Canisters that were actually executed in a round.
panels.title: Executed canisters

panels.description: Distribution of canisters that were actually executed in a round, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Executed canisters distribution

panels.description: Number of rounds for which a canister was not scheduled
panels.title: Canister age, rounds

panels.description: Distribution of number of rounds for which a canister was not scheduled, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Canister age distribution, rounds

panels.description: The number of all canister in a subnet.
panels.title: Total canisters

panels.description: The total number of cycles burned per second in a subnet.
panels.title: Cycle burn rate

panels.description: The total number of cycles burned per second in a subnet by use cases.
panels.title: Cycle burn rate by use cases

panels.description: Total cycle balance (in trillions of cycles) across all canisters on a subnet
panels.title: Subnet cycles balance (in trillions)

panels.description: Total cycle balance (in trillions of cycles) across all canisters on a subnet
panels.title: Subnet cycles consumed (in trillions)

options.content:
- Charts break down the `execute_round` function time into known steps and `(other)`
- `(other)` represents untracked time
- `(other)` should be near zero; a non-zero value indicates a problem

panels.description:
The average duration of an execution round.

Related submetrics:
- subnet queue duration,
- consensus queue duration,
- message duration.
panels.title: Round duration, avg

panels.description:
The average number of Wasm instructions executed in an execution round.

Related submetrics:
- subnet queue instructions,
- consensus queue instructions,
- message instructions.
panels.title: Round instructions, avg

panels.description: Distribution of the duration of executing a round, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Round duration distribution

panels.description: Distribution of Wasm instructions executed while  executing a message in an execution round, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Round instructions distribution

panels.description:
The maximum duration of an execution round.

Related submetrics:

- subnet queue duration,
- consensus queue duration,
- message duration.
panels.title: Round duration, max

panels.description:
The maximum number of Wasm instructions executed in an execution round.

Related submetrics:

- subnet queue instructions,
- consensus queue instructions,
- message instructions.
panels.title: Round instructions, max

panels.description: Distribution of the duration of executing messages in a thread, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Thread duration distribution

panels.description: Distribution of Wasm instructions executed in a thread while  executing a message, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Thread instructions distribution

panels.description: The average duration of a replicated message execution in an execution round.
panels.title: Replicated message duration, avg

panels.description: The average number of Wasm instructions executed in a replicated message in an execution round.
panels.title: Replicated message instructions, avg

panels.description: The maximum duration of a replicated message execution in an execution round.
panels.title: Replicated message duration, max

panels.description: The maximum number of Wasm instructions executed in a replicated message in an execution round.
panels.title: Replicated message instructions, max

panels.description: Distribution of the duration of executing a replicated message, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Replicated message duration distribution

panels.description: Distribution of Wasm instructions executed while  executing a replicated message in an execution round, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Replicated message instructions distribution

panels.description: The average duration of non-replicated query execution.
panels.title: Non-replicated query duration, avg

panels.description: The average number of Wasm instructions executed while handling a non-replicated query.
panels.title: Non-replicated query instructions, avg

panels.description: The maximum duration of a non-replicated query execution.
panels.title: Non-replicated query duration, max

panels.description: The maximum number of Wasm instructions executed while handling a non-replicated query.
panels.title: Non-replicated query instructions, max

panels.description:
Distribution of non-replicated query execution durations, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

Note that queries are not replicated and query load is more or less evenly spread across replicas.
panels.title: Non-replicated query duration distribution

panels.description:
Distribution of non-replicated queries by Wasm instructions executed, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

Note that queries are not replicated and query load is more or less evenly spread across replicas.
panels.title: Non-replicated query instructions distribution

panels.description: The average duration of non-replicated inspect_message execution.
panels.title: Non-replicated inspect_message duration, avg

panels.description: The average number of Wasm instructions executed while handling a non-replicated inspect_message.
panels.title: Non-replicated inspect_message instructions, avg

panels.description: The maximum duration of a non-replicated inspect_message execution.
panels.title: Non-replicated inspect_message duration, max

panels.description: The maximum number of Wasm instructions executed while handling a non-replicated inspect_message.
panels.title: Non-replicated inspect_message instructions, max

panels.description:
Distribution of non-replicated inspect_message execution durations, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

Note that inspect_message executions are not replicated and load is more or less evenly spread across replicas.
panels.title: Non-replicated inspect_message duration distribution

panels.description:
Distribution of non-replicated inspect_message executions by Wasm instructions executed, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

Note that inspect_message executions are not replicated and load is more or less evenly spread across replicas.
panels.title: Non-replicated inspect_message instructions distribution

panels.description:
Distribution of call tree ages at the time when canister calls were made, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

This is how long ago the call context at the root of the call tree was created.
panels.title: Call tree age distribution

panels.description:
Distribution of the call tree depth at which canister calls were made, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

A call tree depth of zero means that the canister call was made from the call context of an Ingress messages or heartbeat / timer. Calls with a call tree depth of 1 or higher were made from the call context of a canister call.
panels.title: Call tree depth distribution

panels.description:
Distribution of call durations, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.

Note that a call may span multiple message executions and be suspended for arbitrarily long while waiting for a response.
panels.title: Call duration distribution

panels.description: The RSS of all sandbox processes
panels.title: Sandbox resident memory

panels.description: The average duration of spawning a sandbox process
panels.title: Sandbox spawn process duration

panels.description: The average duration of executing a message in the sandbox process
panels.title: Sandboxed execution duration

panels.description: The number of sandbox processes in a subnet.
panels.title: Sandbox processes

panels.description: Sandbox cache hit ratio = hits / number_of_message_slices
panels.title: Sandbox cache hit ratio %

panels.description: The average duration of draining the subnet message queue in an execution round.
panels.title: Subnet queue duration, avg

panels.description: The average number of Wasm instructions executed while draining the subnet message queue in an execution round.
panels.title: Subnet queue instructions, avg

panels.description: Distribution of the duration draining the subnet message queue in an execution round, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Subnet queue duration distribution

panels.description: Distribution of Wasm instructions executed while draining the subnet message queue in an execution round, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Subnet queue instructions distribution

panels.description: The maximum duration of draining the subnet message queue in an execution round.
panels.title: Subnet queue duration, max

panels.description: The maximum number of Wasm instructions executed while draining the subnet message queue in an execution round.
panels.title: Subnet queue instructions, max

panels.description: The average duration of draining the consensus message queue in an execution round.
panels.title: Consensus queue duration, avg

panels.description: The average number of Wasm instructions executed while draining the consensus message queue in an execution round.
panels.title: Consensus queue instructions, avg

panels.description: The number of subnet messages executed per second grouped by the method name.
panels.title: Subnet messages by type

panels.description:
Non-replicated queries executed per second

The left Y axis measures replicated messages (shown above the zero line); the right Y axis measures non-replicated queries (shown below the zero line). Note the different scales, as there are usually way more non-replicated queries than other types of messages.
panels.title: Non-replicated query rate

panels.description: Query cache hit ratio = hits / (hits + misses)

targets.expr:
label_replace(
  sum by(ic_subnet) (
    rate(execution_query_cache_hits_total{job="replica",ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])
  )
  / 
  (
    sum by(ic_subnet) (
      rate(execution_query_cache_hits_total{job="replica",ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
    +
    sum by(ic_subnet) (
      rate(execution_query_cache_misses_total{job="replica",ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
  )
  ,
  "ic_subnet", "$1", "ic_subnet", "([a-z0-9]+)-.*"
)

panels.title: Query cache hit ratio

panels.description: Query cache hits per second
panels.title: Query cache hit rate

panels.description: Query cache misses per second
panels.title: Query cache miss rate

panels.description: Query cache evictions per second, i.e. cache entries removed due to the cache size limit
panels.title: Query cache eviction rate

panels.description: Distribution of evicted cache entries duration, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Evicted cache entries duration distribution

panels.description: Query cache invalidations per second, i.e. cache entries removed due to some changes
panels.title: Query cache invalidation rate

panels.description: Distribution of invalidated cache entries duration, aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Invalidated cache entries duration distribution

panels.description: Total query cache invalidation reasons per second, i.e. the number of cache entries removed due to some changes
panels.title: Total query cache invalidation reason

panels.description: Query cache invalidations by time per second, i.e. the number of cache entries removed due to the time changes
panels.title: Query cache invalidation rate by time

panels.description: The total size of the whole subnet query caches, in bytes.
panels.title: Subnet query cache size

panels.description: The total number of the whole subnet query cache elements.
panels.title: Subnet query cache elements

panels.description: The average query cache element size, in bytes.
panels.title: Average query cache element size

panels.description: Total canister log memory usage across all canisters on a subnet
panels.title: Total Subnet Canister Log Memory Usage

panels.description: Average memory usage for canister logs across each subnet

targets.expr:
label_replace(
  avg by (ic_subnet) (
    rate(canister_log_memory_usage_bytes_v2_sum{ic="$ic", ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet", instance=~"$instance"}[$heatmap_period])
    /
    rate(canister_log_memory_usage_bytes_v2_count{ic="$ic", ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet", instance=~"$instance"}[$heatmap_period])
  ),
  "ic_subnet", "$1", "ic_subnet", "([a-z0-9]+)-.*"
)

panels.title: Average Subnet Canister Log Memory Usage

panels.description: The rate of `fetch_canister_logs` management canister query executions per second
panels.title: Fetch Canister Logs Query Execution Rate

panels.description: Distribution of canister log memory usage (per canister), aggregated over **$heatmap_period**.
panels.title: Canister Log Memory Usage
